title: New bacteria in Antarctic ice cores

content.question:
Five new species of bacteria were discovered in Antarctic ice core samples. The nucleotide (base) sequences of rRNA subunits were determined for the new species. The table below shows the number of nucleotide differences between the species.

Which of the following phylogenetic trees is most consistent with the data?

choices.label: There is a phylogenetic tree with a common point to three main branches. One branch is labeled species two. The second branch of the tree starts at the common point and splits into species five and species one. The third branch of the tree starts at the common point and splits into species three and species four.

There is a phylogenetic tree with two main branches from a common point. One branch is labeled species four. The second branch splits into two separate branches. The first of these branches splits into species three and species five. The second of these branches splits into species one and species two.

There is a phylogenetic tree with two main branches from a common point. The first branch splits into two branches. The first of these two branches is split into species three and species four. The second of these two branches is split into species two and species one. The second main branch from the common point is labeled species five.

There is a phylogenetic tree with two main branches from a common point. The first branch is labeled species five. The second branch splits into two branches, one is labeled species three, the other splits into two branches, one is labeled species four, the other splits into two branches, one is labeled species one, and the other is labeled species two.

content.answer: There is a phylogenetic tree with two main branches from a common point. The first branch splits into two branches. The first of these two branches is split into species three and species four. The second of these two branches is split into species two and species one. The second main branch from the common point is labeled species five.

skill.text: 2.B: Explain relationships between characteristics of biological models in both theoretical and applied contexts.
